title.native: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 ストーンオーシャン 2クール
title.romaji: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stone Ocean Part 2
title.english: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: STONE OCEAN Part 2

description:
The second and third cour of JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Stone Ocean.

The legacy of the Joestar family continues with Jolyne as she and her companions take on new Stand users behind the bars of Green Dolphin Street Prison.

(Source: Netflix)
synonyms: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 6 (Part 2)
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: STONE OCEAN The Final Episodes

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

node.description:
Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1059938929485344774)

Freelance animator and designer. Formerly affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287) and known for his extensive work on the *Jojo's Bizarre Adventure* anime series.
Houtani Yukitoshi (宝谷幸稔) is a Japanese animator, animation director, illustrator and character designer.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
_Note: not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/169408/)._

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fringon/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fringon) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/pedro.alcantara.1610) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@fringontv) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@_fringon) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/fringon)

Pedro Alcântara Machado de Vasconcelos (Jacareí, November 22, 1994) is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actor [Ricardo Vasconcelos](https://anilist.co/staff/202508/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Pablo (1st voice - 1st-3rd season; The Backyardigans)
- Beck Oliver (Victorious)
- Tyler Navarro / Dino Charge Red Ranger (Power Rangers: Dino Charge)
- Coby (One Piece Live Action)
- Kim Dong-Ha (Happy Ending)
- Reminald R. "Remy" Remington (Big City Greens)
- Bradley Nicholson (Milo Murphy's Law)
- Charles Ronson (Horizon Zero Dawn)
- Hae-Rang (Sweet Home)
- Howard "Howie" (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Silas Plaskett (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Charles "Charlie" St. George (13 Reasons Why)
- Ron Stoppable (Kim Possible Live Action)
!~

Aimee Anne Duffy is a Welsh singer, songwriter and actress. Her debut album, Rockferry, released in 2008, became the best-selling album in the United Kingdom that year and led to worldwide attention. It spawned the successful single "Mercy". In 2009, Duffy received the Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album for Rockferry, one of three nominations, and won three out of four Brit Awards nominations, for British Breakthrough, Best British Female and Best British Album. In 2010, she made her acting debut in the film Patagonia and released her second studio album Endlessly to moderate success.

In February 2011, Duffy announced an indefinite hiatus from music.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ichiRingo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ichiringo/)

ichigo is the vocalist of [Kishida Kyoudan & The Akeboshi Rockets](https://anilist.co/staff/112181/Kishida-Kyoudan--The-Akeboshi-Rockets).

__[Profile (Obelisk)](http://obelisk.co.jp/c_iehara.html)__

__Masaki Iehara__ is a Japanese composer and arranger, who has worked as as an arranger for Asami Katagiri (under Epic Sony record label). He has also worked for Scoop Music as a CM Producer, and as an arranger for several artists. He currently works for Obelisk Inc.
